title: A Hardy mentor, in letter and spirit
description: An English mathematician of repute, Godfrey Harold Hardy is known for his work in number theory and mathematical analysis. For Indians, though, Hardy will always be the mentor who plucked Srinivasa Ramanujan from relative obscurity and placed him in the echelons of mathematical greats. A look at the life and work of Hardy, and his relationship with Ramanujan…

title: 'You can’t talk to India, China like that': Putin hits back at Trump's tariff

He built his independent fashion house into a global powerhouse, leaving an indelible mark on the fashion world.

193 deaths as Rajasthan receives 63% more rainfall this season
NBA set to investigate Kawhi Leonard's Los Angeles Clippers deal
description: NBA has launched an investigation into Kawhi Leonard and the Los Angeles Clippers following reports of a potential salary cap circumvention. Allegedly, Leonard signed a $28 million endorsement deal with Aspiration, a fintech company, around the same time Clippers owner Steve Ballmer invested heavily in the firm.

‘Is AR Rahman crazy? What a horrible song’: Ram Gopal Varma recalls first response to Rangeela music, reveals how the ‘slow poison’ worked
Afghanistan earthquake: Toll crosses 2200, nearly 4000 injured; rescue under way
description: A devastating 6.0-magnitude earthquake in eastern Afghanistan has claimed over 2,200 lives and injured nearly 4,000, primarily in Kunar province. Rescue operations are ongoing amidst difficult terrain, complicated by aftershocks, including a 4.8-magnitude tremor. International aid is arriving, with India airlifting 21 tonnes of relief supplies to assist the affected population already struggling with fragile housing and decades of conflict.

title: WB assembly chaos: Mamata launches tirade; BJP MLAs dragged out, suspended
description: The West Bengal Assembly erupted in chaos as TMC and BJP MLAs clashed over a resolution addressing alleged atrocities against Bengali migrants. Chief minister Mamata Banerjee accused the BJP of being anti-Bengali and obstructing discussions on attacks in BJP-ruled states. Addressing the House, Banerjee accused the BJP of being against Bangla-speaking people.

title: AIIMS Delhi leads, PGIMER Chandigarh at 2nd position – top 10 medical colleges: NIRF Ranking 2025
Sonia Gandhi voter ID row: Plea alleges she was listed 3 years before citizenship
description: A plea has been filed in a Delhi court seeking action against Sonia Gandhi, alleging her name appeared on the electoral rolls in 1980, three years before she officially became an Indian citizen in 1983. The complainant, Vikas Tripathi, through senior advocate Pavan Narang, argues this discrepancy suggests potential forgery and deception of public authorities.

title: Sonia Gandhi registered as a voter 3 years before getting citizenship, says lawyer in Delhi court petition for probe
Trump speaks on Elon Musk: Calls out plans; reignites political-tech crossover
description: Donald Trump recently commented on Elon Musk, acknowledging his genius while noting some "problems." Trump expressed hope Musk would rejoin the GOP, dismissing the "radical left lunatics." This follows a fallout sparked by Musk's criticism of Trump's tax bill. Despite earlier threats, Trump now wishes Musk well.

Confession without a corpse: Kozhikode's 5-year puzzle of a man lost in marshland
description: Five years after Vijil vanished from Kerala, his disappearance remains a perplexing mystery. Two friends confessed to burying him after a drug overdose at Sarovaram Park, but no remains have been found despite extensive searches. Vijil's parents dispute the drug story, suspecting foul play, leaving investigators grappling with a case shrouded in uncertainty and a family without closure.

Will Taylor Swift attend Travis Kelce and Chiefs game in Brazil on September 5
description: Travis Kelce will play in Brazil on September 5, 2025. Taylor Swift's presence is a big topic. She might attend the Chiefs vs Chargers game. Security arrangements are rumored. Swift's past experience in Brazil is a factor. She has supported Kelce at many games. Her new album releases on October 3. Her schedule might allow her to travel to Brazil.

NIRF 2025: AIIMS Delhi tops medical ranking; check top 10
description: The NIRF 2025 medical rankings have been released, with AIIMS Delhi maintaining its top position for the tenth consecutive year. The list highlights India’s leading medical institutes, including PGIMER Chandigarh and Christian Medical College, Vellore. Rankings are based on teaching quality, research, graduation outcomes, inclusivity, and perception. The top 10 includes both public and private institutions, reflecting India’s growing medical education landscape. This ranking serves as a key guide for prospective medical students.

title: Autorickshaw crashes after road caves in on Delhi’s NH-44 flyover; traffic curbs extended to Wazirabad, ITO as Yamuna swells
Irfan Pathan vs Dhoni: After hookah, old Army gloves controversy storms back online
description: Irfan Pathan is facing renewed scrutiny after an old interview resurfaced where he suggested MS Dhoni favored players who joined him in smoking hookah, sparking controversy.

'Failed FM': Chandrasekhar's 'disgruntled' retort on Chidambaram's GST 'U-turn' claim
description: Kerala BJP president Rajeev Chandrasekhar strongly criticized Congress leader P. Chidambaram's remarks on the GST overhaul, labeling him a "dejected, disgruntled, and failed finance minister." This came after Chidambaram called the GST reforms a belated "U-turn," suggesting they should have occurred eight years prior.

title: GST cut for mid-market hotel segment may spur travel, hospitality demand, but industry feels more should have been done
Asia Cup: India's Dubai schedule revealed - player arrivals, practice timings & more
description: Defending champions India are set to commence their Asia Cup 2025 preparations with practice sessions in Dubai, foregoing a preparatory camp in India. Players will assemble individually, with captain Suryakumar Yadav and coach Gautam Gambhir already en route. India's campaign begins against UAE on September 10, followed by a highly anticipated match against Pakistan on September 14.

Big fight in US court: Trump cites India to justify tariff war
description: Donald Trump has appealed to the Supreme Court, challenging a federal court's decision that limits his power to impose tariffs on foreign imports. Trump defends tariffs on India for purchasing Russian energy, citing it as crucial for peace in Ukraine.

Watch: BJP whip dragged out of Bengal assembly as Mamata shouts 'vote chor'
description: West Bengal Assembly witnessed chaos as Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee accused the BJP of corruption and anti-Bengali sentiment, triggering fierce opposition. BJP chief whip Shankar Ghosh was suspended for disrupting a discussion on Bengali migrants' rights. Marshals escorted Ghosh out after he refused to leave.

Supreme Court directs suo motu PIL on lack of functional CCTVs in police stations
Kunickaa Sadanand says she hid her live-in relationship with a married man for 27 years, fans think it’s Kumar Sanu: ‘He cheated on me’
Soubin Shahir faces double setback from courts, application to travel abroad rejected in Manjummel Boys case
Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay and a novel that shook the British Empire
CCTV footage exposes brutal police attack on Youth Congress member in Kerala
description: CCTV footage revealed the torture of a Youth Congress worker, V S Sujith, at Kunnamkulam police station, sparking protests and a human rights commission investigation. A magistrate ordered an inquiry against four officers after medical tests disproved police claims of Sujith's intoxication. While departmental action was taken against some officers, further action depends on the court's decision.

title: Punjab floods: Amid disaster, rail parts maker switches to boats
description: Hanspal Traders, a railway coach component manufacturer in Kapurthala, has shifted its operations to fabricate boats for Punjab flood relief. Prompted by calls from across the state and encouraged by an MLA, the company is also sharing its designs to involve other manufacturers. They aim to produce boats manually, focusing on aiding people and transporting essential supplies.

title: Aligarh dowry horror: ‘Jump’, dares hubby, woman leaps off 2nd floor
description: In Aligarh's Daunkoli village, Archana, a 35-year-old woman, allegedly jumped from her roof after enduring years of dowry-related abuse. A video surfaced showing the aftermath, leading to a police case against her husband and in-laws. They are accused of demanding additional dowry of Rs 5 lakh and a motorcycle.

title: Magic of Bumrah: In a world of Messi vs Ronaldo, he is the Ibrahimovic - an outlier
description: Jasprit Bumrah thrives on challenges. He is a non-conformist. He has always chosen the unconventional route. While most athletes are swayed by the Messi-Ronaldo rivalry, his inspiration comes from Zlatan Ibrahimovic, a monster in his own right. During Covid-19, in an Instagram Live with Rohit Sharma, Bumrah had said: "I love Ibra. I can relate to his story that people did not take him seriously and then he became a star. I can relate as I think people took me lightly initially and then I proved them wrong, I am still trying."

title: Delhi rains: Alipur flyover portion caves in
description: New Delhi faced disruptions due to heavy rainfall. A portion of the NH-44 flyover collapsed. Waterlogging and traffic jams were widespread. The Yamuna River exceeded the danger level. Chief Minister Rekha Gupta assessed the situation and assured assistance. The IMD forecasts more rain in the coming days. Interstate cooperation is underway to manage the crisis. Air quality remained satisfactory.

title: Gretzky and Canada’s identity: Why he no longer defines hockey
description: Wayne Gretzky, once the undisputed symbol of Canadian hockey, is now being re-evaluated as the sport evolves. While his legacy remains significant, the rise of international stars and Canada's changing role in the global game have sparked an identity crisis. Canadians are urged to embrace a future where their hockey identity extends beyond a single figure.

title: After paralysis, Reese Ketler hears a doctor’s unexpected message
description: In 2019, Reese Ketler's hockey career ended abruptly due to a spinal cord injury. Doctors initially feared he might never walk again. Through intensive rehab and unwavering determination, Ketler defied expectations and returned home early. Now, he inspires thousands as a content creator, proving life continues after tragedy and sharing a message of hope and resilience.

title: 'I was very troubled by her': Man shoots wife dead in busy market in Gorakhpur
description: In Gorakhpur, Vishwakarma Chauhan fatally shot his wife, Mamta, in a public market on Jail Road. The incident occurred after an argument outside a photo studio where Mamta had gone.

title: Minor rape survivor sent back to accused family by CWC, raped again; 10 booked
description: In Panna, Madhya Pradesh, police filed an FIR against ten individuals, including Child Welfare Committee members and officials from the women and child development department, under the POCSO and Juvenile Justice Acts. The action was prompted by the CWC's decision to return a minor rape survivor to the accused's family, leading to further abuse.

title: Deion Sanders gives heartfelt fatherhood advice to Jaguars rookie Hunter
description: Deion Sanders offers heartfelt advice to Travis Hunter as he navigates fatherhood and his NFL career with the Jacksonville Jaguars. Their bond, forged at Jackson State and Colorado, transcends football. Sanders' guidance emphasizes correcting past shortcomings in fatherhood, reflecting their deep connection as Hunter embraces his roles as a husband, father, and rising NFL star.

title: Amazon's cost-cutting rule: New phone policy; Staff must report personal usage
description: Amazon is now requiring employees to meticulously report the percentage of work-related usage on their company-issued phones. This is to adjust their $50 monthly reimbursements proportionally, based on personal use. This phone monitoring is part of CEO Andy Jassy's "hardcore culture reset" and cost-cutting measures, leading to employee frustration and anxiety about job security.
